title: Research Guides: Public Health: Complementary & Alternative Medicine
author: Nedelina Tchangalova
description: Guide to selected resources in Public Health. CAM
cleaned_text: Complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) refers to health philosophies, approaches, and therapies that are generally not taught in medical schools, used in hospitals, or reimbursed by medical insurance companies; however awareness, research, and acceptance in this area is increasing. This is a selected list of information sources related to complementary and alternative medicine available in McKeldin Library and free on the Internet. Databases at UMD Libraries These are just some of the databases that the University of Maryland College Park offers in Public and Community Health. To see more databases covering these areas of study, use [Database Finder](http://lib.umd.edu/dbfinder), [Journal Finder](https://umaryland.on.worldcat.org/atoztitles/browse), and/or [Citation Finder](https://umaryland.on.worldcat.org/atoztitles/search#article). Free Databases from the National Institutes of Health (NIH)
